p: To characterize the function of the sequiterpene synthases SgSTPS1 and SgSTPS2, the recombinant proteins SgSTPS1 and SgSTPS2 were expressed in E. coli, and purified proteins were used for activity assay. GC-MS analysis of the SgSTPS1 enzymatic products revealed the formation of predominantly β-caryophyllene (Figure 9A, Figure S4A), along with a minor amount of isocaryophillene and humulene when utilizing FPP as a substrate. While using GPP as a substrate, there were trace amounts of linalool and geraniol produced at the retention times of 10.42 and 13.37 min, respectively (Figure S5). This indicated that SgSTPS1 is a sesquiterpene synthase with caryophyllene synthase activity that could be responsible for β-caryophyllene production in S. glabra.
